business.headline: Succession Wars: How betrayal, murder and greed tore apart 'House of Gucci'Maurizio Gucci's quest to perfect the family empire ended in four gunshots on March 27, 1995, on the steps of his Milan office.

Isha Ambani is Harper's Bazaar Icon of the Year, dedicates award to mother, daughterIsha Ambani dedicated the award to her mother, Nita Ambani, the Chairperson of Reliance Foundation. Isha said her mother is her role model who has "paved the way for me".

Centre recommends reducing GST on packaged water and bicycles below Rs 10,000The Group of Ministers (GoM) to decide on GST on health and life insurance premiums in its meeting on Saturday decided to exempt GST on premiums paid by individuals, other than senior citizens, for health insurance with coverage of up to Rs 5 lakh.

Who is Vasundhara Oswal, daughter of Indian billionaire, detained in Uganda?Vasundhara Oswal was reportedly seized by a group of 20 armed men at the family's extra neutral alcohol (ENA) plant. Local officials have connected her arrest to an ongoing investigation into the case of a missing person.

HDFC Bank Q2 results: Net profit rises 5% to Rs 16,820 croreHDFC Bank's net interest income (NII), a key measure of profitability, came in at Rs 30,114 crore, reflecting a 10% year-on-year increase, although slightly below the market expectation of Rs 30,306 crore.

Karnataka to impose cess on Zomato, Uber, payments to support gig workersKarnataka Labour Minister Santosh Lad said that the charge would be levied only on transport and not on the purchase of products.

Disney-Reliance venture to stream live sports exclusively on Hotstar: ReportWhile Reliance's JioCinema currently streams IPL cricket, Hotstar holds rights to other prestigious events like the International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, the English Premier League, and the Pro Kabaddi League.

Ashneer Grover withdraws mismanagement plea against BharatPe from NCLTThe plea alleged mismanagement and oppressive conduct by the fintech company's board. The withdrawal of the plea follows a settlement reached between Grover and BharatPe on September 30, 2024.

India to impose laptop import restrictions to boost local manufacturing: ReportThe planned restrictions, if enforced, could impact the country's IT hardware market, which is currently valued at between $8 billion and $10 billion.
Sensex, Nifty close in green as banking, metal stocks lift marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 218.14 points to close at, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.20 points to end at 24,854.05.

DA hike by 3%: Check new salary, arrear calculations for employees, pensionersThe DA hike increase is effective from July 1, 2024, and was confirmed during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

India's growth rate shines bright in global economy, says Ajay Banga A lot of that growth is in India, is driven by the domestic market as well, which actually is a healthy sign, in some ways, said Ajay Banga, World Bank president.

IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

Explained: Why European Central Bank cut interest rates againECB cuts interest rates: This marks the first time the ECB has implemented back-to-back rate cuts since it began its current cycle of easing in response to falling inflation rates.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Devendra Fadnavis, Chandrashekhar Bawankule in BJP's first list for MaharashtraThe BJP on Sunday released its first list for the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly election. Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and state BJP chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule are among the 99 candidates named by the party.

Multiple agencies probe Delhi school blast, forensic teams test mysterious powderThe National Investigation Agency (NIA) is inspecting the area near a CRPF school in Delhi's Rohini, where a blast occurred on Sunday morning, to determine if there are any terror links to the incident. Forensic teams have arrived at the scene and are analysing a white powder-like substance found near the school's wall.

Bomb threats to 6 IndiGo flights today, airline assures passengers' safetyIndiGo, in an official statement, said that it remains committed to upholding the highest standards of security and is acting swiftly to address any potential risks.

Delhi school blast heard 2 km away, explosives positioned for shockwaves: SourcesDelhi school blast: The explosion outside CRPF school in Delhi was a directional blast and was positioned in a way to create shockwaves, sources said, adding that the blast was heard two kilometres away from the site.

How F&O addiction is turning dreams into debt for retail investorsThe high-stakes world of Futures and Options trading is attracting millions of Indians. It is mostly younger investors who are betting big on F&O despite lacking awareness. Experts see gambling-like behaviour as people keep investing even while losing money. Is there a way of being successful in F&O trading?

New Zealand script first-ever Test win in India since 1988 India vs New Zealand, Bengaluru Test: New Zealand chased down the 107-run target to complete their first-ever Test win in India since 1988 on Sunday, breaking a 36-year-long drought in Bengaluru.

32 Indian flights receive bomb threats in a single day, only one divertedSeveral Indian carriers, including Air India, IndiGo, Akasa Air, Vistara, SpiceJet, Star Air, and Alliance Air, received numerous bomb threats in the past few days.

No need for panic, 3 hours won't define us: Rohit Sharma on Bengaluru Test lossIndia vs New Zealand, 1st Test: Captain Rohit Sharma remained upbeat despite India's shock loss to the visiting New Zealand team on Sunday. Rohit said three hours of poor cricket, in which they were bowled out for 46, will not dictate their decision-making for the future.
Why do you doze off on the couch but are wide awake in bed?Ever find yourself dozing off on the couch, only to be wide awake the moment you hit the bed? Let's find out from experts why this happens.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Supreme Court's role as people's court must be preserved: Chief JusticeThe Chief Justice asserted that one is entitled to criticise the Supreme Court for the inconsistency of legal doctrine or an error, but one cannot look at its role or its work from the perspective of outcomes.

Kangana Ranaut says 'free-spirited' women are called witches, Samantha agreesKangana Ranaut made a post about women being connected to their higher self, 'carrying an infectious free spirit', which is often not understood by society, and they are labelled witches.

Centre's job to maintain law and order: Atishi on blast outside Delhi schoolDelhi School Blast: Chief Minister Atishi reacted to the explosion outside the CRPF Public School earlier today, saying it was the responsibility of the central government to ensure law and order prevails in the national capital.

Elon Musk promises $1 million award each day to anyone who signs his petitionElon Musk awarded $1 million to an attendee at a campaign town hall in Pennsylvania on Saturday and also promised to give away the same amount each day until November's election to someone who signs his online petition supporting the US Constitution.

Kajol celebrates 29 Years of DDLJ, calls the film 'OG of Karva Chauth'Bollywood actor Kajol celebrated 29 years of Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge on Instagram. Even after almost three decades, the film has continued to be a beloved classic in Indian cinema.

Omar Abdullah kicks off Kashmir Marathon, runs 21 km in 2 hours without trainingThe marathon event aims to showcase Jammu and Kashmir as a peaceful destination capable of hosting international events. Participants included top long-distance runners from India, Asian gold medallists and some of the best runners from Europe and Africa.

Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2024: A chain of empowermentEvery Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year awardee presented the award to the winner of the next category of high-achieving women, thus creating a chain of empowerment.

Men now trying to be more like women: Kalli Purie at Bazaar Women of the Year AwardsKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, gave the keynote address at Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2024. Here's the full text.

Japan 'zombie' train haunts passengers ahead of HalloweenOn a trip from Tokyo to Osaka, passengers on Japan's bullet train, the Shinkansen, had a thrilling experience where they braved an encounter with the living dead. The eerie experience was inspired by the hit 2016 South Korean action-horror film "Train to Busan".

Uddhav Sena to hold crucial meet amid Maha Vikas Aghadi seat-sharing deadlockAmid a deadlock over distribution of seats for the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly polls, Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray will hold an emergency meeting with party leaders today.

Kiara Advani to Parineeti Chopra, Bollywood celebs extend wishes on Karwa ChauthBollywood stars Kiara Advani, Shilpa Shetty, and Parineeti Chopra extended their wishes on the auspicious festival of Karwa Chauth.

Somy Ali on should Salman Khan apologise to Bishnoi community: It makes no senseIn an exclusive interview with us, Somy Ali opened up on Lawrence Bishnoi's threats to Salman Khan and why she wants to meet the gangster.

I am sorry on behalf of Salman: Somy Ali to Lawrence BishnoiFormer actor and women's rights activist Somy Ali said she was sorry on behalf of Salman Khan. In an exclusive interaction with India Today, she said that Salman didn't know about the Blackbuck.

sports.headline: Rohit Sharma thanks Bengaluru crowd for sticking around in rain-marred TestIndia captain Rohit Sharma thanked the passionate Bengaluru crowd for sticking around in the rain-marred Test match. Sharma said that they do not take the fans lightly and respect their effort of coming to the ground.

Shubman Gill bats on centre wicket after Bengaluru Test, raises hopes of Pune returnStar India batter Shubman Gill was seen practising in the nets after India's loss against New Zealand in the first Test at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

On Day 4, Pant had played a sensational 99-run innings to help India wipe out the deficit vs New Zealand.

Where is R Ashwin: Fans puzzled with Rohit Sharma's move in BengaluruRohit Sharma did not bring Ravichandran Ashwin into the attack early in the second innings of the Bengaluru Test match. The move puzzled fans as left-hander Rachin Ravindra drove New Zealand's chase on Day 5.

Harmanpreet to lead as India announce strong 22-man squad for Germany seriesIndia will take on Germany in a two-match hockey series in New Delhi on October 23 and 24. Harmanpreet Singh will lead a power-packed 22-man squad, announced on Sunday, October 20.

Messi hat trick helps Inter Miami set record points in single MLS seasonLionel Messi scored a stunning hat trick on Sunday and guided Miami to a terrific win over New England Revolution. In the process, Inter Miami shattered the record for most points ever scored in a single season of the tournament.

Virat Kohli fires up Bengaluru crowd, urges fans to cheer louder on Day 5India vs New Zealand, 1st Test: Virat Kohli took up the responsibility of pumping up the Sunday morning crowd. Thousands of fans turned up to watch the final day's play of the thrilling Test in Bengaluru.

Cricket Australia CEO Nick Hockley set to step down in March next yearCricket Australia CEO Nick Hockley will step down in March 2025, concluding a five-year tenure marked by strategic reforms and achievements.

Djokovic pays tribute to Nadal after final encounter: You have an incredible legacy Six Kings Slam exhibition: Novak Djokovic honoured his long-time rival, Rafael Nadal. The emotional exchange marked the end of their legendary rivalry as Nadal prepares for retirement.

'Injury-free' Shreyas Iyer keen to make India Test team comebackMumbai batter Shreyas Iyer is keen on making India comeback. Iyer has stressed that he is injury free and pushing his limits in terms of fitness. Shreyas made his comments after scoring a century against Maharashtra in the Ranji Trophy.

IND vs NZ, 1st Test, Bengaluru Weather Highlights: India lose as rain stays awayIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) 1st Test, Bangalore Weather Highlights: India lose by 8 wickets in Bengaluru as rain keeps away at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. No rain came after 10:15 am and that led to an easy chase from New Zealand after surviving the initial burst from Jasprit Bumrah.

South Africa, New Zealand set to enter new era of champions  Women's T20 World Cup: Sophie Devine's New Zealand and Laura Wolvaardt's South Africa will be looking for glory they face each other in the summit clash on Super Sunday at the Dubai International Stadium.

Watch: Ramandeep takes stunning one-handed catch in India A vs Pakistan ARamandeep Singh's spectacular diving catch dismissed Pakistan A's Yasir Khan and turned the tide in India A's Emerging Asia Cup clash. The catch, combined with stellar bowling, helped India A secure a dominant victory in their defense of 183 runs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
